Mike Schwartz wrote:

> hi,
>
> I'm running a moderately large crawl right now (5000 seed URLs, each
> limited in the RobegerFrontier to 50 docs max, using 100 ToeThreads), and
> after running for about 12 hours I notice in the thread report that 
> all but
> 1 thread are stuck in ABOUT_TO_GET_URI, with one thread in
> ABOUT_TO_RETURN_URI (for many minutes).  I tried killing (and replacinng)
> the ABOUT_TO_RETURN_URI and it caused there now to be 2 active threads.

Is this your issue Mike: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html#glibc2_3_2?

Otherwise, take a couple of thread dumps -- Send a 'kill -SIGQUIT' to 
the java launcher process.  The thread dumps will show in 
heritrix_out.log -- and send us the output.

Yours,
St.Ack

>
> can anyone suggest what I need to do to get the rest of the threads going
> again?  It seems like some kind of deadlock/livelock condition is 
> happening.
>
> thanks
>   - Mike
>
